decision_conditions: The proposed two-storey side extension by virtue of its excessive size, scale and positioning would be dominant and incongruous which would detract from the character and scale of the main dwellinghouse and the immediate surrounding area. It is therefore considered contrary to Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012), and Policy Guidance 36 of the Council's Supplementary SPD Residential Design Guidance (2013).

The proposed front porch by virtue of its scale, design and positioning would be excessive, dominant and incongruous, appearing as an obvious addition and would not appear as an original part of the dwellinghouse, detrimental to the character and appearance of the host dwellinghouse and wider streetscene. It is therefore considered contrary to Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012), and Policy Guidance 38 of the Council's Supplementary SPD Residential Design Guidance (2013).
description: Demolition of detached garage and erection of part two storey and part single storey side and front porch extension
